metadata.synopsis: Astarion Avatar confesses about his vampire affliction

3.speaker: Player
3.text: *Brutal as she is, Lae'zel values honesty. She'll respond fairly and rationally. Maybe.*
3.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Brutal as she is, Lae'zel values honesty. She'll respond fairly and rationally. Maybe.*

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *Lae'zel seems to have a touch of respect for you. Perhaps she'll take the news with grace - or whatever passes for grace for a githyanki.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Lae'zel is not exactly the forgiving type. It might be best to keep your bloody secret to yourself.*

30.speaker: Player
30.text: It's time you know the truth: I'm a vampire. A vampire spawn, technically.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: It's time you know the truth: I'm a vampire. A vampire spawn, technically.

112.speaker: Lae'zel
112.text: Of course you are. I may be an outsider to these lands - but I am hardly ignorant of your kind.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: Of course you are. I may be an outsider to these lands - but I am hardly ignorant of your kind.

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: Your breath reeks of blood-iron. You slink like a darkling and preen like a parrot. You wear your identity like a second skin.

87.text: Chk - a vampire spawn? An undead slinks among us.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: Chk - a vampire spawn? An undead slinks among us.

117.speaker: Lae'zel
117.text: I've half a mind to slit your neck for the secrecy. It is to your benefit that you've proven yourself so useful in spite of your - condition.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: It's time you know the truth: I'm a vampire. A vampire spawn, technically.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.context: InternalNodeContext: Character saw Astarion use his 'bite' ability on someone else (probably in combat, but not necessarily) and confronts him about being a vampire.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Two punctures deeper than the others; minimal seepage. Shka'keth - a vampire. An undead slinks among us.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: You've caught me. Sorry about the bite.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: It's true - there's no use denying it.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Don't be ridiculous. I'm just a normal elf, an innocent elf.

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.text: No more lies, Astarion. These wounds you've branded me with tell your bloodthirsty tale.

105.speaker: Lae'zel
105.text: No more lies, Astarion. The wounds you inflicted tell your bloodthirsty tale.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.context: InternalNodeContext: Character was bitten by Astarion in gameplay.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: So an undead slinks among us.
49.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite this companion during the night, but you woke up and discovered he was a vampire. You talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsj

109.speaker: Lae'zel
109.text: I am not averse to your kind, Astarion. Queen Vlaakith herself dwells in undeath, and she is no less revered for it - and no less alluring.
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: I suppose you can't be blamed. Sinewed muscles, sanguine flesh - I must be quite the temptation.
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

57.speaker: Lae'zel
57.text: But sweet as my blood is, it is not for the quaffing; luscious as my meat is, it is not to be dined on.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: So much as smack your lips when I'm near, and I will sever you piece by piece.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: I'll leave you to guess which piece I plan to start with. Am I understood?
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

28.speaker: Player
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: Oh, good. I'd hate to see you subject yourself to my further mockery.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I'll do my very best to fight off my hunger.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.text: Chk. Anything less than a full promise is hardly your 'very best'.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I'm not making you a promise I can't keep.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: So be it. At least this time, you are truthful.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

114.speaker: Lae'zel
114.text: I've drawn my limits. It would be a great pity for you should you cross them.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: A vampire? Well that explains the pallor.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: A vampire? Well that explains the pallor.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

63.speaker: Shadowheart
63.text: Given our group's nature, I don't see much harm. We're each monsters in the making, after all.

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: I'd just better not wake in the night to find fangs at my throat.

76.speaker: Wyll
76.text: Fine - as long as he keeps his fangs off our necks.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: Oh, and a quick word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: Quite right. We all have our hungers to sate. Some just happen to hunger for blood.

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: Yeah. And I'm way too hot to touch.

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: Hunting with vampires? Never thought I'd see the day.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

39.speaker: Wyll
39.text: Very well - but I'm keeping an eye on you. And no wisecracks about having us for supper.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

80.speaker: Gale
80.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we? Of course we are.

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: We all have our hungers to sate. Some just happen to hunger for blood.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: Vamps don't scare me. As long as they keep their teeth to themselves.

108.speaker: Karlach
108.text: No sense judging someone for who they are. Except devils, obviously.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: Let's consider the subject closed, shall we? Now - is there anything more to discuss?

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: Let's consider the subject closed, shall we? Now - is there anything more to discuss?

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: Let's consider the subject closed, shall we? Now - is there anything more to discuss?

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: A vamp, huh? Interesting. Keep your teeth to yourself, Astarion, and we won't have any issues.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: Anyway, you'd burn your tongue off if you went for this neck.

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we?

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

121.speaker: Gale
121.text: We all have our hungers to sate. Some just happen to hunger for blood.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: So an undead slinks among us.
85.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite A DIFFERENT companion during the night, but they woke up and discovered he was a vampire. They talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsj

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: But so much as smack your lips when I'm near, and I will sever you piece by piece.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: It is to your benefit that you've proven yourself so useful in spite of your - condition.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: But let me be clear: so much as smack your lips when I'm near, and I will sever you piece by piece.

122.speaker: Lae'zel
122.text: You've been keeping a secret, Astarion. And I don't like secrets.
122.context: InternalNodeContext: Companion confronts Avatar Astarion, telling him they know he's a vampire. Triggers if you make it to Act 2 without him telling you himself or revealing it via camp night bite scene/using bite attack in front of you.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: What do you have to say for yourself, vampire?

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: Do you think because I'm an outsider that that makes me ignorant?

22.speaker: Lae'zel
22.text: Your breath reeks of blood-iron. You slink like a darkling and preen like a parrot.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: You had a choice, Astarion, and you failed me. But I'm not an unreasonable woman.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: I'm a vampire spawn, if you want to be technical.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: Which means, technically, you're far more easier to kill than a full-fledged vampire. How very fortunate for me.

113.speaker: Lae'zel
113.text: How fortunate for you that I am a reasonable woman.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I should have told you earlier. No excuses.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: And here I was hoping you'd embarrass yourself with some pathetic justification.

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: Since you'd deny me the entertainment, you'll make me a promise instead.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: I'll let you live. I'll even let you keep the privilege of my alliance. In exchange, you'll keep your fangs away from me and anyone in our group.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: Oh, good. I'd hate to see you subject yourself to my further mockery.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I'll do my very best to fight off my hunger.

118.speaker: Lae'zel
118.text: Chk. Anything less than a full promise is hardly your 'very best'.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'm not making you a promise I can't keep.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: So be it. At least this time, you are truthful.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: You know where I stand. And if you so much as smack your lips when I'm near, I will sever you piece by piece.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: I'll leave you to guess which piece I plan to start with. Now -

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: Is there anything more we should discuss?

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Pardon? You think I'm a vampire?

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: Don't tell me you intend to cling to this ridiculous deceit.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Fine, I'm a vampire. How did you figure it out?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I'm not a vampire, Lae'zel. Now drop it.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: Your lie is plain as fangs in your mouth, and still you stand by it.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: Which means you are either a halfwit, or you think I am.

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: For now, I'll let you live. I'll even let you keep the privilege of my alliance.

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: But if you so much as smack your lips when I'm near, I will sever you piece by piece.
